thread.title: How to Make a Leprechaun Trap With Your Kids for a Fun St. Patrick's Day
thread.title_full: How to Make a Leprechaun Trap With Your Kids for a Fun St. Patrick's Day

title: How to Make a Leprechaun Trap With Your Kids for a Fun St. Patrick's Day
text:
How to Make a Leprechaun Trap With Your Kids for a Fun St. Patrick's Day 10 hours ago Capture the luck of the Irish with an easy DIY leprechaun trap Share Tumble   
If your kids are still desperately missing their Elf on a Shelf, we've got step-by-step directions on how to make a leprechaun trap that will chase those elfin blues away. This trap is easy enough for kids to make on their own (with maybe just a tiny bit of help). Supplies: 1. Cover the box Image: Amy Vowles/SheKnows 
Cut out an opening out of the top of the box with scissors. Cover the outside of the box with green construction paper. Use clear tape to keep it in place. Don't worry if the tape shows, we will cover that up in the next step. 2. Add the garland 
Cover the edges of the box with the St. Patrick's Day garland. 3. Decorate the box
